The GIS database and data in the product are subject to change and the accuracy and completeness cannot be and is not guaranteed. CALIFORNIA STATE PARKS MAKES NO WARRANTIES OR GUARANTEES, EITHER EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED AS TO THE COMPLETENESS, ACCURACY, OR CORRECTNESS OF SUCH PRODUCT, NOR ACCEPTS ANY LIABILITY, ARISING FROM ANY INCORRECT, INCOMPLETE OR MISLEADING INFORMATION CONTAINED THEREIN. California State Parks (CSP) are also known as the California Department of Parks and Recreation (DPR).

All products that use these data must include the following disclaimer: Disclaimer: "Parcel boundaries are approximate and should not be considered legal descriptions. Maps are intended for study purposes only."

descript.abstract: Boundaries of California State Park Units and Properties as of July 1, 2015. This dataset does not represent official property boundary determinations. This is a publicly-downloadable version intended for general reference, planning, and/or use in studies. Park unit and subunit names, classifications, management status, and administrative codes are under continuous revision and subject to change. Unit and Subunit names, management status, and administrative codes are in effect beginning in the State of California Fiscal Year of release. Download from http://www.parks.ca.gov/pages/862/files/caStateParkBdysMapLinks201603e.zip. Monitor www.parks.ca.gov for the latest information.
descript.purpose: California State Park boundaries for general reference and not for official or legal property boundary determination or description.
descript.supplinf: This version of California State Park (CSP) boundaries is for public download. California State Park System Unit names and the names of their included Subunits are tabulated below, along with classification abbreviations and numeric, administrative codes in parentheses. The names are official beginning in the State of California Fiscal Year of their release. CSP names, codes, and the relationships among units and subunits are subject to change. Monitor www.parks.ca.gov for the most current information about California State Parks. California State Park System classification abbreviations are: State Park (SP) State Historic Park (SHP) State Recreation Area (SRA) State Beach (SB) State Vehicular Recreation Area (SVRA) State Natural Reserve (SNR) Wayside Campground (WC) State Marine Park (SMP) State Seashore (SS) State Marine Reserve (SMR) --SubUnit abbreviations: Natural Preserve (NP) Cultural Preserve (CP) State Wilderness (SW) Unit Name (Unit Number) -- SubUnit Name (Number) ------------------------------------------------ Admiral William Standley SRA (118) Ahjumawi Lava Springs SP (190) Albany (223) Anderson Marsh SHP (701) -- Anderson Marsh NP (970) Andrew Molera SP (491) Angel Island SP (231) Annadel SP (246) Año Nuevo SP (222) -- Año Nuevo Coast NP (228) -- Quiroste Valley CP (232) Antelope Valley California Poppy Reserve (SNR) (560) Antelope Valley Indian Museum SHP (579) Anza-Borrego Desert SP (622) -- Angelina Spring CP (628) -- Anza-Borrego Desert SW (624) -- Coyote Canyon CP (613) -- Culp Valley CP (620) -- Hawi-Vallecito CP (632) -- Little Blair Valley CP (629) -- Piedras Grandes CP (608) -- Santa Rosa Mountains SW (627) -- Southern Overland Trail CP (609) -- We-Nelsch CP (626) Armstrong Redwoods SNR (208) Arthur B. cntorgp.cntorg: California State Parks, Acquisitions & Real Property Services Division, Surveys Section

cntinfo.cntinst: California State Parks (CSP) are also known as the California Department of Parks and Recreation (DPR). Contact the CSP Surveys Section for property boundary matters; contact the CSP Enterprise GIS Team for technical, geospatial matters.

idinfo.datacred: California State Parks: Northern Service Center; Acquisition and Real Property Services Division; Surveys Section; Marketing and Business Development Division (formerly Planning Division); Facilities Management Division; Enterprise Geographic Information Systems Team.

citeinfo.origin: Callifornia State Parks Marketing and Business Development Division
citeinfo.title: California State Parks Sytem (Map of July 1, 2013)
citeinfo.othercit: CSP park boundaries are available as downloadable data at <web link> <under revision> California State Parks (CSP) are also known as the California Department of Parks and Recreation (DPR). Monitor www.parks.ca.gov for the latest information about California State Parks.

citeinfo.title: California Department of Parks and Recreation Website
citeinfo.othercit: State of California Department of Parks and Recreation (DPR) (also known as California State Parks (CSP))

citeinfo.origin: California State Parks Marketing and Business Development Division
citeinfo.title: Planning Milestones for the Park Units and Major Properties Associated with the California State Park System
citeinfo.othercit: Digital document title "Planning Milestones" as posted at www.parks.ca.gov. Contains California State Park System statistics, park administrative names history, and related information (last accessed 2014.08.28).

citeinfo.origin: California Department of Parks and Recreation, Acquisitions & Real Property Services Division, Surveys Section
citeinfo.title: Land Ownership Records Map
citeinfo.othercit: Maps depict Management Parcel Acquisitions, dates, acreage. Easements and Appurtenances described, Land Disposals indicated.

attracc.attraccr: Each polygon has attributes of unique CSP Unit and Subunit names and administrative codes, management status codes, and system-generated (not official), approximate acreages. CSP names and codes were compiled with the best available information and are in effect beginning in the fiscal year of their release. CSP unit classifications, names, management status, and codes are subject to change.

dataqual.logic: The Operational Boundary (Opbdys) is a logical construction based on parcel ownership/management information maintained by the Division (was Office) of Acquisition and Real Property Services Division. In geodatabase implementation, the feature class Opbdys participates in a topology with the feature MgmtParcels. A new feature StPrkMgmtParcels is used to update the MgmtParcels feature with the "best available information", including easemetns and appurtenances generated by Acquisions and Real Property Services Divions in the form of AutoCad Map based Land Ownership Records. Enterprise GIS Team synchronizes bounaries with the Land Ownership Records (LOR) in AutoCad MAP format. The publicly downloadable version of the boundaries dataset is a commonly used subset of the above. This dataset does not represent official or legal property boundary determinations or descriptions and is under continuous revision and subject to change without notice. Copyright 2008, 2012 California State Parks. All rights reserved.
dataqual.complete: All major Units and Properties of the California State Park System are represented in this dataset. Disclaimer: This version of California State Park (CSP) boundaries does not represent official or legal boundary determinations or descriptions. Maps derived from the GIS version are intended for general reference, planning, and/or study purposes. A quality assurance / quality control (QA/QC) report or formal completeness and accuracy assessment has not been completed on this dataset. CSP names, codes, and management designations are in effect beginning in the State of California Fiscal Year of their release. Boundaries are in continual revision and are subject to change. Consult the CSP Surveys Section for the most current boundary information; contact the Enterprise GIS Team for technical, geospatial matters. Monitor www.parks.ca.gov for the latest general information about California State Parks.

horizpa.horizpar: A formal accuracy assessment was not performed. CSP boundary horizontal accuracy is estimated to be consistent with that of 1:24000-scale USGS quads.

vertacc.vertaccr: No vertical (elevation) data are included in this dataset. California State Park elevations range from a low of 230 feet below sea level in the Salton Sea State Recreation Area (SRA), to sea-level in State Beaches (SB) and related properties, to a high of 10,804 feet on the summit of Mount San Jacinto in Mount San Jacinto State Park (SP).

srcinfo.srccontr: Individual county datasets and statewide data collections. Land acquisitions based on parcels.
Parcel boundary delineations and documentation from the CSP Surveys Section
Nominal and historical representations of CSP unit boundaries compiled by the U.S. Geological Survey

procstep.procdesc: The shapefile version of California State Parks boundaries is produced by dissolving one to many parcels comprising a park unit or subunit into a single, multi-part polygon record that represents combinations of park classifications and management status. See classification abbreviations in the Supplemental_Information section of this metadata.

Unit names within the California State Park System, feature class designations (park, reserve), and geographic point coordinates were reconciled with the USGS Geographic Names Information System (http://geonames.usgs.gov). The above information is in continual revision. Monitor www.parks.ca.gov for the latest information about California State Parks.
procstep.srcprod: California State Park System Unit Names

procstep.procdesc: The GIS versions of CSP boundary polygons do not represent official or legal boundary determinations or descriptions. The polygons are assembled by the CSP Enterprise GIS Team from the best available sources, including CSP Surveys Section data, County Assessor parcel data, historical departmental Land Ownership Record Maps, and USGS quads in both digital and hardcopy. The CSP Enterprise GIS Team converts the source data into digital geospatial data in shapefile, enterprise geodatabase, and Google Earth KMZ formats. Selected subsets of the data are compressed into ZIP format and posted on a public download site. Download content is subject to change. Monitor www.parks.ca.gov for the latest information about California State Parks.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.
Unit Names as determined by the California State Parks Commission

distinfo.distliab: See access and use constraints information.
